alert.note: Alert for Northern Clinton; Northern Lycoming; Tioga (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 19 at 7:10AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN CLINTON...NORTHERN LYCOMING...AND TIOGA COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 708 AM EST, a band of heavy snow was along a line extending from 17 miles northwest of Wellsboro to near Emporium and moving east at 55 MPH. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Westfield and Gaines around 715 AM EST. Tamarack, Keeneyville and Westport around 725 AM EST. Renovo around 730 AM EST. Mansfield and South Renovo around 735 AM EST. Hyner around 740 AM EST. Slate Run and Millerton around 745 AM EST. * This includes the following highways... Route 6 from near Gaines to the Bradford county line. Route 15 from south of Trout Run to Lawrenceville. State Road 14 from Trout Run to the Bradford County line. State Road 120 from Bucktail State Park to Hyner View State Park. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
